item.title: Iran Releases French Citizen After 2 Years in Detention, Officials Say
item.description: Olivier Grondeau had been accused of spying while visiting Iran on a tourist visa. President Emmanuel Macron of France had denounced his detention as ...

item.title: After Israeli Strike Kills More Than 400, Palestinians Tally the Dead
item.description: For two months, a cease-fire spared Palestinians the grim task of identifying bodies. With Israel resuming its assault, they are back at it.

item.title: Viktor Orban Is a Conservative Lodestar. Now He Wants to Fix the Price of Eggs.
item.description: The Hungarian prime minister, who pioneered themes dear to U.S. conservatives, is seeking to tame inflation with methods that remind his critics of co...

item.title: Indonesian Parliament Passes Bill That Critics Say Evokes Authoritarian Past
item.description: Legislators revised a law to allocate more civilian posts for military officers, a move that harked back to the era of the dictator Suharto.

item.title: In Syria, Being Wanted Went From Something to Fear to a Badge of Honor
item.description: The ousted Assad dictatorship kept lists of millions of wanted people. Now, Syrians are openly asking whether they “have a name” on any of those lists...
